snippet: When Americans go to the polls next month they will cast a vote not just for president but for one of two profoundly different visions for the future of the country’s health care system.
abstract: American voters will chose between two profoundly different visions for the future of the country's health care system when they cast ballots in the presidential election; victory by Pres Obama would mean a full implementation of the Affordable Care Act and a wide expansion of the health safety net, whereas Mitt Romney would likely repeal much of the law and attempt to shrink costs related to Medicaid and Medicare.

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: When Americans go to the polls next month they will cast a vote not just for president but for one of two profoundly different visions for the future of the country’s health care system.

headline.seo: Health Care Direction Awaits Verdict of Presidential Race
headline.main: This Election, a Stark Choice in Health Care
headline.print_headline: This Election, A Stark Choice In Health Care

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
